title: X7
author: X7
content: Raise a glass for those of us who:Participated in the early days of spreading information to those who didn't understand BitcoinDonated some crypto to someone who you wanted to share your excitement with during the nascent yearsHelped advise on fascinating projects in the early days when it was all relatively new for most peopleInvested in Bitcoin start-ups while helping to further expand the eco-systemBought something for you or gifted something to someone using bitcoinJust fucking held your bitcoin with a massive jawlineSold your bitcoin early and have some regretsHad Bitcoin change your and the lives of those around you For those of us who have seen the rise of this fun experiment turn into an actual asset class and the backbone of some really cool things, cheers to what is hopefully the next bull run. See you in 4 years

comments.author: Darker45
comments.body: Cheers to everybody who remains, who made it up to this day! It wasn't easy!These are the times when people who don't understand call us lucky. We got some Bitcoin in one way or another and our worth increased significantly. Others would say "easy money". Well, it wasn't that easy. Hodling isn't that easy. To resist the urge to sell when Bitcoin skyrockets from $1,000 to $20,000 in just a span of months isn't easy. Neither is it easy to keep hodling when after reaching $20,000, it freefalls all the way to $3,000. To just watch the price move from $6,000 to $69,000 and then from $69,000 to $15,000 and from $15,000 to $72,000 and do nothing isn't easy.

comments.author: kotajikikox
comments.body: What a proof that patience does indeed deliver. I truly believe that happiness and success come to those who wait. We do not always need to be taking actions actively. Simply waiting sometimes is already a form of action. I know it was difficult but saving up money to buy bitcoin, studying and learning everything there is to learn about crypto, eventually buying bitcoin, and holding bitcoin no matter what the current value is and how much FUD is spreading around.I am excited for what is about to come next but for now I do believe we deserve some taps on our backs. Well done, mates!

comments.author: pooya87
comments.body: To those who found out about Bitcoin during one of its many long bear markets, entered and watched the price go down but never even flinched. This is pat on my own back too  since I started when price was around $400 and watched it go down all the way to $150 and even stay at $200 for about a year.

comments.author: NotATether
comments.body: And for those of us who still have most of our coins!

comments.author: Hewlet
comments.body: Quote from: pooya87 on November 13, 2024, 04:41:36 AMTo those who found out about Bitcoin during one of its many long bear markets, entered and watched the price go down but never even flinched. This is pat on my own back too  since I started when price was around $400 and watched it go down all the way to $150 and even stay at $200 for about a year.bro! This is crazy. Starting off at $400 and staying around till $89k is a journey that's worth a thousand tap on the back. That literally means you've stayed to watch Bitcoin grow above 223 times it value at the time you started investing with all the bulls and beers and the disbelief and temptation to sell that must have come with staying this long.Though I can't say the same thing that I've witnessed a remarkable beer like the majority of the early birds that came in even before Bitcoin got to $1k but coming in at the time Bitcoin was around $40k and seeing it get to $89k in less than a year and still climbing is something I've come to see as one of the best Discovery of my life and for the little chunk I've already built and for the  journey ahead of us, it's worth at least the tiniest tap on the back and hopefully in the coming years, we will talk about these era as the then days when Bitcoin was low.

comments.author: davis196
comments.body: A round of applause for those, who survived throughout the years. The waiting was definitely worth it.And a minute of silence, for those who got scammed and left Bitcoin forever. For those, who forever lost access to their BTC wallets.For those, who lost faith in the future of Bitcoin/crypto. For those, who lost money day trading. For those, who betrayed Bitcoin Core and joined the Bitcoin Cash, Bitcoin Trash, etc. "forked Bitcoin" nonsense. For those, who wasted BTC on a crypto casino in the early days of Bitcoin.Let's have a minute of silence for all of them. They have also contributed a little bit for the success of Bitcoin.

comments.author: LogitechMouse
comments.body: Quote from: X7 on November 12, 2024, 11:59:24 PMParticipated in the early days of spreading information to those who didn't understand BitcoinDonated some crypto to someone who you wanted to share your excitement with during the nascent yearsBought something for you or gifted something to someone using bitcoinI've participated in these 3 that's for sure. Although I'm not an expert in crypto space, I believe that I gave some advice to some users here in the forum in one way or another. I gave advice, shared information to these newbies because I'm also once a newbie and got some help from experts here. I donated some of my crypto to those who are in need, but not directly crypto. I converted my crypto to our local currency and donated it to them. That's okay, right?  I've bought many things already using Bitcoin. Too many to say right now. Quote from: X7 on November 12, 2024, 11:59:24 PMHelped advise on fascinating projects in the early days when it was all relatively new for most peopleInvested in Bitcoin start-ups while helping to further expand the eco-systemI don't know if I participated in these 2, but... Quote from: X7 on November 12, 2024, 11:59:24 PMJust fucking held your bitcoin with a massive jawlineSold your bitcoin early and have some regretsHad Bitcoin change your and the lives of those around you HELL YEAH!!!!!!I've been holding Bitcoin for years already (more than 4 years to be exact), and I'm patiently waiting for the right time to sell them all. That doesn't mean that I'm out already, but we all have strategies.  As for selling my Bitcoins, I've been earning Bitcoin since 2018 and been selling them as well until now. Just imagine if I choose to hold all of the Bitcoins that I got during that time until now. I would've been a millionaire in an instant.  Bitcoin changed my life in a way that I didn't imagine. comments.author: jcojci
comments.body: Congratulation for the increasing of Bitcoin price. Those who bought Bitcoin at $60k can breath as they can sell their Bitcoin at any of the price now. They can sell instantly and leave Bitcoin to enjoy their profit or they can still hold for some time and sell when the price make another new ATH.Yes, Bitcoin change our lives as we are Bitcoin investor who held our Bitcoin from a long time ago. We can celebrate our waiting time by selling Bitcoin (if that is our plan) at the price now and enjoy the profit. Patience will not lie to those who already held Bitcoin and they now see what is the benefit of Bitcoin to them. This also proof to other people who doesn't believe in Bitcoin because they see what happen to Bitcoin now.

comments.author: hugeblack
comments.body: I believe that since 2013, many people have started using Bitcoin for investment reasons other than for making payments or financial freedom to conduct transactions away from government restrictions. Therefore, the options will be limited to developers/early adopters who continue to develop voluntarily and without the possibility of making profits in the foreseeable future.

comments.author: Apocollapse
comments.body: Congratulations, people!Indeed, many people are saying holding/patience is hard, but I would say it's because they're not busy enough with their life which make them keep thinking about their Bitcoin investment.The rise of Bitcoin price in a week beat gold price in a year, if we compare it to Year to Year, Bitcoin make 4x times more than gold.

comments.author: Fiatless
comments.body: Quote from: pooya87 on November 13, 2024, 04:41:36 AMTo those who found out about Bitcoin during one of its many long bear markets, entered and watched the price go down but never even flinched. This is pat on my own back too  since I started when price was around $400 and watched it go down all the way to $150 and even stay at $200 for about a year.It is common to see people call early adopters lucky. But it was not luck they made them keep their coins for a long time. Without bravery, many people who owned Bitcoin at the early stage would have sold or abandoned it a long time ago. I celebrate with these uncommon minds who stood their ground in the face of temptations and intimidation. For those of us who are just a few years old, we are also lucky to join the train at this point. Maybe we might also celebrate after a few bull runs in the future.

comments.author: Yaunfitda
comments.body: Yeah, I was around when the price is <$1k. Then we had our bull run in 2017, and majority of us stuck with it thru thick and thin and then we have the pandemic in 2020, had the next bull run in 2021, and see Bitcoin by then as store of value or something as hedge.And now we are again in another bull run, so how time flies to be honest. Maybe some of us hasn't had any investment for that long, and majority could be closing in their 10 years on Bitcoin market. So everything is good for now, but we are still looking for next year when we hit that 6 digits.
